parInfo.parNotes:
"The MHub can send data to Mprofiler over various communications mediums, such as SMS, GPRS, Satellite etc. There can be a total of 8 different communications mediums, some of which are still to be implemented.The communications Mediums implemented to date are: 1. SMS 2. GPRS 3. Roaming SMS 4. Roaming GPRS 5. Satellite 6. Wifi 7. Bluetooh 8. Other
The MHub is configured to use the communications mediums in order of priority. Thus an option will be to have GPRS as the highest priority, followed by SMS, and then perhaps Roaming GPRS. This is done in patameter "User CM Preference Order". What this means is that the MHub will always try to be in a position where it can send data over GPRS, and will send events that have been configured to be sent over GPRS. If however for some reason GPRS is not available, the MHub will fall back to the second priority medium which in this case will be SMS. Now events that have been configured to be sent over SMS will be sent.
The value of this parameter indicates the amount of time that the particular Communications Medium will be held after the MHub has deemed it to be unavailable, before dropping to the next available Communications Medium. This is to prevent messages being sent over SMS if GPRS becomes available for only a short while.
For example if the GPRS Debounce Timer was set to 120 seconds (times are in seconds for the debounce timers) and the GPRS network became unreachable then events that are marked for GPRS transmission will be extracted from the flash and queued for 120 seconds after GPRS has become unavailable.
Once 120 seconds has passed with no GPRS coverage the next available CM (SMS for example) determined from the "User CM Preference Order" will take over and the current queue will be destroyed and a new queue set up with events that must be sent over that particular CM. In this example, SMS.
"
"See SMS DebounceTimer"

parInfo.parDescription: "Preference order of communications mediums usage as selected by user"
parInfo.parNotes:
"As described in SMS DebounceTimer, the MHub is configured with a priority oder of the required communications mediums. This parameter is where this assignment is done. This is a string of 8 bytes represented as hexadecimal values where the highest priority medium is specified first then the second one, etc.
Each medium has a unique number they are: - 00: SMS - 01: GPRS - 02: Roaming SMS - 03: Roaming GPRS - 04: Iridium Satellite - 05: Wifi - 06: Bluetooth - 07: Other - 64: Not Used
As an example: Say we want to specify GPRS then SMS in that order and nothing else you would set it to: 0100646464646464
- or - Say you want to use only GPRS, then set it to 0164646464646464
default: 0100030264646464"

parInfo.parDescription: "Allows selection of GPRS SMS or Circuit switched SMS. This should not be changed from the default value unless there are network reasons. If this is changed SMS\'s will not work if there is no GPRS !"
parInfo.parNotes: "In some GSM networks, it is possible to send a SMS from the MHub making use of the GPRS mechanism. There is generally no difference in the cost of sending the SMS, however the SMS will be sent faster. This should really only be used if the MHub is configured in such a way that will require sending many SMS messages quickly in succession. The disadvantage of using the method of sending SMS's, is that if the MHub finds itself outside of GPRS coverage, it will not be able to send the SMS, whereas if this option is turned off, the MHub would be able to send the SMS."

parInfo.parName: See Roaming Operator as Home Enable
parInfo.parDescription: "If enabled registration on selected operator networks when roaming will be treated as home network registration allowing normal event reporting."
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
In order to provide flexibility in costing of data transmission using both GPRS and SMS over roaming networks, the MHub has the ability to send certain events only when the MHub is in a local network for instance, and not if it is roaming. However, there may be instances where if a MHub roams on a specific "partner" network, that the data costs are similar to those of the local network. So in order to facilitate this, the MHub is able to regard a certain roaming network as actually being a "Home" netwotk. Enabling this parameter will enable the ability of the Mhub to see a roaming netwotk as a Home network, and apply the Home network data transmission rules."

"When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available."

"When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available."

"When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available."

"When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available."

"As described previously, the MHub makes use of various communications mediums, such as SMS, GPRS, roaming SMS etc. And the MHub is configured with a order of priority of these communications mediums. Thus if GPRS is the highest priority, the MHub will always attempt to be in a position where it can send messages over GPRS.
The Communications Medium Policies (of which there are 8) are used to specify for individual events over what communicatiosn mediums the event may be transmitted. "

parInfo.parDescription: "TCP Port through which the socket will be opened"
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub connects to MProfiler vis GPRS the Mhub opens up a socket to the MProfiler Server. This parameter specifies the port through which the socket will be opened."

parInfo.parDescription: "This is the maximum amount of time that the unit will wait, after receiving a header, for the rest of a message to be received."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub starts recieving data over GPRS, it needs to wait until the entire message has been recieved bofore it can start decoding the message. If the MHUb recieves only the forst part of the messaage, this parameter defines the time that the MHub will wait to recieve the remainder of the message. If the entire message is not recieved within this time. The MHub will discard the message."

parInfo.parDescription: "Switches the calling line identification on or off. This allows the unit to know the origin of a voice or data call."
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None"

parInfo.parDescription: "The maximum number of attempts that a unit may make to login, before tearing down the socket."
parInfo.parNotes: "Using GPRS, the MHub will open a socket connection to the MProfiler server, and then attempt to login into MProfiler. If the login credentials on the MHub are incorrect, MProfiler will reject the the login attempt. This parameter specifies the number of time that the MHub will accept a rejection before closing the socket (XXX - Note - will Mprofiler ever close the socket in the event of incorrect logins)"

parInfo.parDescription: "The time that the (N)Ack may take to reach the MHub before the related transmission attempt expires."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the Mhub send data to the Mprofiler using GPRS, it always expects a message back from the Mprofiler, either a positive of negative acknowledge. However the Mhub will only wait a certain time for this reply from Mprofiler before the message attempt by the Mhub is expired. This parameter specifies the length of time that the MHub will wait for a response from Mprofiler, the default is usually 120 seconds."

parInfo.parDescription: "The amount of time that establishment of a socket will be blocked after a socket is deliberately closed to allow for incoming voice or data calls."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the Mhub has an open socket to Mprofiler and and there is an incommng voice or data call. The MHub has to close the socket. After the call is completed, the MHub may then need to reopen the socket again. In the instance that say the voice call is dropped, and the caller makes the call to the MHub again, we not not want the Mprofiler to immediately open the socket again immediately just to have to close it again with the second call comes in. This parameter will set a time in seconds from when the socket is closed till when the MHub will open up the socket again"

parInfo.parDescription: "Maximum number of attempts the MHub will make to transmit a packet before the socket is torn down. The message is also failed."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub transmits a message over GPRS to the MProfiler, tyhe MHub expects a response to that message. If it does not recieve the response with the time specified in parameter xxx, then the message is failed and needs to be resent. This parameter specifies the number of retries that the MHub will make to send a specific message before the message is failed completely. If the message is an event to be sent to Mprofiler, event though the specific message fails after all the retries, the event(s) will be resent at a later stage."

parInfo.parDescription: "Switch all debug statements ON or OFF"
parInfo.parNotes: "The value represents the debug time-out in minutes. Setting the value to 255 is a special case causing the debugs to be permanently active."

"Turning ON this parameter will enable the accident reconstruction functionality of the MHub918."

parInfo.parDescription: "Only write accident reconstruction records if ignition is ON"
parInfo.parNotes: "When accident reconstruction is enabled on the MHub, certain information is recorded every second that is to be used in the event of an accident to reconstruct the accident. Limitations can be placed on the recording of the accident data. Enabling this parameter will result in the accident data only being recorded when ignition is ON. "

parInfo.parDescription: "Set this bit to verify that the selected speed of the vehicle is greater than required minimum"
parInfo.parNotes: "Accident reconstruction data is recorded every second. Limitations can be placed on the recording of data to ensure that only relevant data is recorded. The MHub does not really need to record data when the vehicle is standing still. If this value is enabled, then the accident recording will only occur if the speed of the vehicle is greater than the speed specified in the "Minimum Required Speed" parameter under the Accident Reconstruction section."
"Only raise accelerometer events if ignition on or inside of trip"
"Non Trip AR Log every 60s"
"Accelerometer Manual Calibration. Disable Auto Calibration and use values supplied with manual calibration"
"Accelerometer Wake-up from sleep"
"Accelerometer Unplug Verification is used in conjunction with Mains Voltage to determine if a unit is being unplugged and moved."

parInfo.parDescription: "Minimum Speed at which any accident reconstruction records will be written if this option is selected"
parInfo.parNotes: "If parameter Verify Speed is enabled, the MHub is instructed to only record accident data if the speed if the vehicle is greater than the value specified in this parameter."

parInfo.parDescription: "Use Flash 1 or Data Flash Card for the Accident Reconstruction Log"
parInfo.parNotes: "The MHub918 can record accident data to either the internal memory, or to the flash memory card inserted into the memory card slot on the underside of the MHub918 PCB. The ability to write the accident data into the memory card implies that a bigger memory card will be able to hold more accident information. The values are as follows: 0 = Internal Memory 1 = Expanded Memory"

"The MHub has 3 LED's that are used to indicate various operational states of teh MHub, this is particularly usefull during the installation and fault diagnosis processes to determine of the MHub is operating correctly. However from a vehicle being stolen scenario, flashing LED's will draw attention to the MHub. It is thus possible to turn OFF the LED's completely by disabling this parameter."

parInfo.parNotes: "Set this value to 1 to enable debug information to be streamed out of the USB port, else set it to 0 to disable it"
"Insurance Led Style. GREEN Hardware Ok, RED Hardware Fault - Triggers upon device plug in. "

"Trip Source Mains Dev."
"Trip Source Accelerometer the accelerometer movement has to exceed the accelerometer movement threshold for ignition on"

"Trip Source GPS Speed the gps speed has to exceed the speed threshold for ignition on. GPS speed is only used if the GPS signal is deemed good e.g. 3D lock for longer than 5 seconds with HDOP less than 100m"
"Trip Source OBD2 Speed and speed above 0km/h will trigger ignition on"
"Trip Source OBD2 RPM and RPM above 0 will trigger ignition on"
"Trip Source CANBus if CANBus activity is present ignition on. Most vehicles switch off the Vehicle CANBus outside of trip. Verify in the vehicle before enabling."
"Trip Source Geo Location the unit creates a geo lock around current location. If vehicle moves more than 5m from that location ignition on."
"Trip Source Trigger the trigger mechanism can be used to enable ignition on. Can be used for application where standard ignition sources are not available."
"Trip Source GSM if the unit detects movement of the unit relative to cell towers ignition on"
"Determines if ignition is on by measuring the difference between the current voltage level and the previous level"

parInfo.parDescription: "Maximum number of accumulated errors before the modem is rebooted"
parInfo.parNotes: "As described in the parameter Reboot Limit, the MHub will issue a reboot command to the modem if it detects a problem with the modem. However if an error is received in response to an instruction to the modem, the MHub will first retry the instruction. This parameter specifies the number of accumulated errors that the MHub can receive from the modem before it will issue a reboot command to the mode."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables suspension of a socket for maintenance purposes"
parInfo.parNotes: "Setting this parameter to 1 will allow the MHub to suspend the socket. Thus function is needed to be able to read some data from the modem such as the signal strength, or to look for an incomming SMS"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables the unit to close a socket so that voice and data calls may be dealt with"
parInfo.parNotes: "In order to be able to answer an incomming voice call, the MHub must close a socket connection if it is currently open. Setting this parameter to 1 will allow the socket to be closed. If this is set to 0, then the MHUb will not be able to close the socket, and thus a voice call will not be possible."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables a permanent TCP socket to MProfiler"
parInfo.parNotes: "The ways in which the MHub can implement GPRS usage is very flexible, to be able to cater for various client requirements and customize such things as data usage etc. One method of GPRS operation is to specify that GPRS socket will remain permanently open. Enabling this parameter will instruct the MHub to open up a socket and attempt to keep the socket open at all time. Should the socket drop for any reason, the MHub will immediately reopen the socket again."

parInfo.parNotes: "This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default index forced trigger ON or OFF. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF"

parInfo.parNotes: "This paramete allows for the setting of the GPRS Class of the Modem. In most instances the Mhub should never have to change the class of the modem, however it is possible for a GSM network to change the class of the modem, then the MHub may need to change it back. The value of this parameter defines to what class type the MHub will set the mode: 00 - MHub will not set the Modem Class 01 - MHub will set the modem to Class B 02 - Mhub will set the modem to Class CG 03 - MHub will set the Modem to Class CC For correct opetation of the MHUb, the modem should be set to class XXX "

parInfo.parNotes: "This works in conjunction with the "Session Attempts Before Standoff" parameter. If this parameter is enabled then the MHub will do an APN reattachment during the standoff period."

parInfo.parNotes: "The Mhub918 has a feature that will allow an external device such as a PC or PDA to take complete control of the modem. The Mhub will however only allow this for a certain maximum time. This parameter specifies the maximum amount of time in seconds that the MHub will relinquish control of the modem to an external device."

"If GPS speed is used to calculate trip distance, the accuracy of trip distance will be negatively affected when GPS lock is lost. By adding the distance between the last known position and position where GPS lock was obtained again, this error can be reduced. "

parInfo.parNotes: "Sends input 8 on/off event when GPS antenna is connected/disconnected"
"GPS Aid Request Disabled. To Not Allow the unit to request GPS Aid from MProfiler."
"GPS 10Hz Mode. Will output GPS Speed at 10Hz."
"GPS Software Antenna Connection Status detect antenna presence in software instead of hardware detection."

parInfo.parDescription: "User name used when logging onto MProfiler over a TCP socket."
parInfo.parNotes: "When connecting to MProfiler using GPRS, the MHub needs to uniquely identify itself to MProfiler before the connection will be accepted. It identifies itself by means of the MProfiler User Name. before the connection will be acc epted, an entity on MProfiler must already exist with the same MProfier User Name as the UnitID on MProfiler. Care must be taken to ensure that no two MHub's are configured with the same MProfiler User Name, as then the information from two different MHub units will be sent o to the client application as a single unit. Typically the MSISDN of the SIM card can be used."

parInfo.parDescription: "Password used to log onto a TCP socket session with MProfiler."
parInfo.parNotes: "If the MProfiler login requires a password from the MHub whe the MHub logs into the MProfiler, that password is stored in this parameter. "

"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This parameter effectively defines the time period over which the RPM pulses are counted to calculate the actual RPM. A value of 10 could equate to 0.5 seconds."
"This is the RPM calibration factor. "

"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This parameter effectively defines the time period over which the distance pulses are counted to calculate the actual distance and speed. A value of 20 could equate to 1 second."

"Calibration factor for the speed sensor input. This parameter contains the calibration factor that will convert the pulses recieved from the speed sensor into accurate distance, speed and acceleration values. The calibration factor is essentially the number of pulses receieved from the speed sensor when the vehicle travels 100m."

"The MHub always sends data to the MProfiler, this includes sending data to MProfiler via GPRS and SMS. When data is sent via SMS, the MHub needs to know where the SMS must be sent to - this will typically be a SMPP Gateway or even a modem directly connected to the MHub."
"When communicating over SMS, the Service Center Address is used, this can also be called SMSC, and will be provided by the GSM service provider."

"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This caters for the situation where a socket is being torn down and a voice call is immediately made active followed by sending an SMS. This sometimes causes temporary network rejection of an SMS submission. This is normally temporary can be ignored.
The ATZ command is also skipped. The Default value used to be 0. It has now been changed to 1 as the ATZ can cause problems on the Telit modems."

parInfo.parName: Ignition OFF Source from Main Voltage Threshold
parInfo.parDescription: "Main Voltage Threshold for Ignition Off if Ignition Source from Main Voltage"
parInfo.parNotes: "When main voltage is used as the source of ignition, this parameter is the voltage threshold below which ignition will be assumed OFF. Typically in a 12V vehicle this should be 13V, the parameter is in 100mv steps, thus the value of the parameter will be 130. Setting this value to 0 switches off this functionality and the unit will fall back to normal ignition off detection."

parInfo.parDescription: "Voltage threshold when unit will sleep quicker."
parInfo.parNotes: "Voltage threshold when unit will sleep quicker. In case the vehicle is parked for many days, reduce the impact of the MHub running at full power drain."

parInfo.parDescription: "The distance between successive position reports during a trip"
parInfo.parNotes: "The distance between successive position reports during a trip"

parInfo.parDescription: "This can be used to indicated version information regarding the configuration that was used"
parInfo.parNotes: "This can be used to indicated version information regarding the configuration that was used. Eg. Default V01"

parInfo.parDescription: "The number of seconds the SIM commissioning process must pause after a number of attempts to commission the SIM. "
parInfo.parNotes: "The number of seconds the SIM commissioning process must pause after a number of attempts to commission the SIM. "

parInfo.parDescription: "Number of SIM commissioning attempts before the unit stands off for a configurable period."
parInfo.parNotes: "Number of SIM commissioning attempts before the unit stands off for a configurable period. Setting this parameter to zero disables the stand-off feature. "

parInfo.parName: Long Modem Power Off Sequence Time
parInfo.parDescription: "Number of seconds that that unit waits before and after powering off the modem to allow internal processes to complete. "
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Number of seconds that that unit waits before and after powering off the modem to allow internal processes to complete. "

parInfo.parDescription: "The amount of seconds that must pass in between the the unit updating its records of surrounding GSM Cell tower info. "
parInfo.parNotes: "The amount of seconds that must pass in between the the unit updating its records of surrounding GSM Cell tower info. "
"Accelerometer Movement Delay. Accelerometer Movement Flag will only be set if the Accelerometer Movement Threshold is exceeded for at least the Accelerometer Movement Delay."
"Anti Theft Feature Enable. Uses Accelerometer Motion Threshold and Delay settings ,Ignition and Input 2"
"Time To Hazard in seconds"
"Time To Siren in seconds"

"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Acc Min Braking Duration is the minimum duration to trigger accident event. Configure duration in 10mS units e.g. 100 is 1.0 seconds with maximum configurable value 2.55 seconds"
"Anti-Theft Button Time-Out in seconds"
"Service Events will be raised every Service Interval boundary. If 0 this functionality is switched off."

parInfo.parDescription: "The period between successive periodic position reports if vehicle idle"
parInfo.parNotes: "When a vehicle is travelling (ignition is ON) mostly it is required that the MHub will send events at regular intervals. This parameter specifies the interval in seconds between which the MHub will send Periodic Position events which the vehicle ignition is ON and it is in an excessive idle state."

parInfo.parDescription: "Periodic CanBus Delay to be used in Event Generation."
"Periodic Custom CanBus Delay to be used in Event Generation"
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

parInfo.parName: Excessive Acceleration and Harsh Braking Delay
parInfo.parDescription: "Delay used for Excessive Acceleration and Harsh Braking Event Generation"
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub detects an excessive braking or acceleration violation, this parameter will specify the minimum duration in seconds of that violation before an exception event will be generated."

parInfo.parDescription: "Delay used for Excess Idle Event Generation"
parInfo.parNotes: "Excessive Idle is when the vehicle is standing still with the ignition or engine still on. In order to prevent the excessive idle event being generated when the vehicle is simply stopped at a traffic light, this parameter will specify the minimum duration in seconds that the vechile must have been in the idle state before the vehicle is assumed to be in an excessive idle state. XXX - is 0 an appropriate default value?"

parInfo.parDescription: "Minimum time of excessive speed before a Speeding Event is generated"
parInfo.parNotes: "In order to provide a driver with a bit of leeway with regard to speeding - for instance when overtaking and exceeding the speed limit for only a short period, the MHub implements a minimum speeding time. The vehicle must therefore be speeding for longer than the minimum time before a speeding event is generated. This parameter specifies that minimum speeding time in seconds."

parInfo.parDescription: "Minimum time of excessive RPM before a Excess RPM Event is generated"
parInfo.parNotes: "This parameter will allow the RPM to exceed the configured limit for a time without the excessive RPM event being generated. If RPM remains above the limit for longer than the time specified in this parameter in seconds, then an exception event will be generated."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is suspended"
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub suspends a socket connection to Mprofiler, it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to suspend the socket - just so that MProfiler knows about this. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is closed."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub closes a socket connection to Mprofiler, it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to close the socket. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is resumed after a suspend."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub resumes a socket connection to Mprofiler after it has been suspended, it is able to notify MProfiler that it has resumed the socket connection. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when the power state of the 801 changes."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub changes its power state (Full, IDLe, SLEEP) it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to change its power state.Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality."

parInfo.parDescription: "The destination address of the next sms to be sent. This excludes event report sms\'s"
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

parInfo.parDescription: "Driver key time out before trip start"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is relevant when a driver key is used, and linked to the immobilizer function of the MHub. When the driver key is inserted, and the MHub authenticates it, it will turn the relevant output on for a certain time, whicle waiting for the ignition to be turned ON. If ignition is not turned on within the time indicated by this parameter, the output will be turned OFF, and the driver will then need to reinsert the key again before the vehcile can be driven. The value is in seconds and the default is 30 seconds"

parInfo.parDescription: "Driver key time out after trip end"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is relevant when a driver key is used, and linked to the immobilizer function of the MHub. A driver inserts a valid key, the output goes ON, the driver starts the vehicle and drives off. When the driver turns the ignition OFF, the output can remain on for a certain time, thus allowing the driver to start the vehicle again without having to reinsert the key. (this is particularly usefull if a driver is struggling to strat a vehicle). This parameter specified the length of time is seconds that the output will remain ON after the driver has turned Ignition OFF. The default value is 30 seconds."

parInfo.parDescription: "Delay after Ignition on before trip start indication"
parInfo.parNotes: "When starting a vehicle, the cranking of the engine may result in the battery voltage fluctuating substantially, enough so to cause the ignition detection of the MHub to detect multiple ON/OFF transitions on the ignition line. Also if a driver is struggling to start a vehicle, the driver may attempt a number of sarts before the vehicle finally starts. In these cases the MHub should not generate many trip start end end events. In order to prevent multiple start and end events, this parameter will specify the time in seconds over hich the ignition line must be constantly ON before a valid trip start is detected. The default parameter is 10 seconds"

parInfo.parDescription: "Delay after Ignition off before trip end indication"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is similar to the trip start delay, whereby after ignition is turned off, the MHUb will wait for the number of seconds before generating the Trip End Event. "

parInfo.parDescription: "Speed Threshold at what vehicle is considered stationary"
parInfo.parNotes: "It is possible to configure the MHub so that even if a vehicle is travelling very slowly, it is still deemed to be idling (standing still). This is also used to combat the effects of GPS speed jumps. Sometimes when a vehicle is stationary, the GPS sensor can report low speeds occasionally. Now if the vehicle is supposed to be in an Idle exception state at that time, it is important that the GPS reporting a speed of say 2KM/h does not cancel the excessive idle state. This parameter is used to specify the a speed in km/h below which the vehicle is deemed stationary."

"Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed sensor input as a source for speed of the MHub. Note that it is important that the speed calibration is correctly done and is accurate when using the speed sensor as the source of speed."
"Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed provided by the GPS as a source for speed of the MHub."
"Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed provided by the Vehicle Network connection as the source for speed of the MHub."

"Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed sensor input as the source for distance (odometer) of the MHub. Note that it is important that the speed calibration is correctly done and is accurate when using the speed sensor as the source of distance."

"Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the information provided by the GPS to calculate the odometer reading of the MHub. As this method uses the GPS, it is very important that the GPS will have coverage throughout the entire trip, as outages of GPS during a trip will cause inaccuracies in the calculation of the odometer."
"Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the Vehicle Network read distance as the source for distance (odometer) of the MHub. "
"This is the speed limit in km/h above which the vehicle will be deemed to be speeding."

parInfo.parDescription: "RPM limit at which point an exception is occuring"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the RPM limit in x100 RPM units above which the vehicle will be deemed to be exceeding the RPM limit."

parInfo.parDescription: "The period between sucessive periodic position reports during a trip"
parInfo.parNotes: "When a vehicle is travelling (ignition is ON) mostly it is required that the MHub will send events at regular intervals. This parameter specifies the interval in seconds between which the MHub will send Periodic Position events which the vehicle ignition is ON and it is not in an excessive idle state. "

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Unit Sleep Mode 0: Normal 1: Sleep Mode "
parInfo.parNotes: "This parameter will allow the MHub to enter the sleep state. This is the lowest power state of the MHub. 1=Enable"

parInfo.parDescription: "GPS to idle power mode. Updates position every 30 seconds. GPS Speed and direction not available. 0: Normal 1: Idle Mode"
parInfo.parNotes: "This parameter will allow the Mhub to enter into its IDLE power save mode. In the idle state, GPS positions are updated internally to the MHub every 30 seconds, and speed and direction values are not available. 1=Enable Idle Mode"

parInfo.parDescription: "Unit wakes up periodically from sleep to check for messages if Ultra Low Power Mode is disabled."
parInfo.parNotes: "When sleep mode is enabled, and the MHub has entered sleep mode, it is possible to configure the MHub to still periodically wake up and check to see if there are any SMS messages that have been sent to the MHub while it was in sleep mode. Setting this parameter will enable this functionality."

parInfo.parName: Enable Modem Power off in Sleep
parInfo.parDescription: "NOT USED - Enable Modem Power off in Sleep. 0: Modem Idle Mode(W32) 1: Modem Off"
parInfo.parNotes: "NOT USED - When the Mhub has enetered sleep mode, the modem can either be turned OFF, or it can enter an idle mode. This idle mode of the modem is called W32K mode, and placed the modem into a very low power state, but still giving the modem the ability to recieve an SMS. If teh modem is turned OFF, it cannit recieve a SMS. This parameter will dictate which power mode for the modem to use: 0: Modem Idle Mode(W32) 1: Modem Off"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Deep Sleep Power Mode: Master Clock running 32Khz. Modem Sleep Scan Not Available. Wake-up from Ignition Only."
parInfo.parNotes: "In addition to the IDLE and SLEEP power modes of the Mhub, there is also an Deep Sleep Power state, where the MHub will only wake up from the ignition line being turned ON. It cannot periodically wake up to check for incomming messages. Setting this parameter will enable this Deep Sleep Power Mode."
"If enabled the unit will go to sleep faster if Mains voltage drops below the Mains Voltage Sleep Threshold"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable to keep unit alive if comms from MHub Diagnostic or MProfiler"
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable to keep unit alive if comms from MHub Diagnostic or MProfiler. MHub Diag - Keep Alive for 10 Seconds MProfiler - Keep Alive for 10 Minutes"

"The fleet code is a value between 0 and 65535 that is used for driver key comparison. The driver key is also programmed with a fleet code, and the fleet code and the driver key must match the fleet code on the MHub (this Value) before the driver key can be authenticated."

parInfo.parDescription: "Vehicle class the MHub is installed into"
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

parInfo.parDescription: "This value indicate the maximum speed threshold at which point it is safe to disable a vehicle"
parInfo.parNotes: "The MHub has the ability to be connect to the vehicle in such a way that it is possible to immobilize the vehicle. The recommended way to connect into the vehcile for driver key and immobilizer usage is to connect to the starter motor of the vehicle. This will prevent the vehicle from being started unless a valid driver key is used. However it is also possible to connect the MHub in such a way that it will interrupt the ignition signal to the rest of the vehicle. This will also prevent the vehicle from being started unless a valid driver key is used, but this will also allow the vehcile to be immobilized and the engine turned OFF at any time. In order to provide some safety in this scenario, this parameter specifies a minimum speed, above which the vehcile will not be immobilized, even if instructed to do so. "

"This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait in full power mode after ignition is turned off until it enters IDLE mode. Idle mode must be enable in parameter "Enable IDLE Power Mode" before this will take effect."

"This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait in IDLE power mode before it enters IDLE mode. Sleep mode must be enable in parameter "Enable Sleep Mode" before this will take effect."

parInfo.parDescription: "This indicates if the MHub is a sealed unit or not."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub is an 802 unit. This parameter is set, that enables specific MHub802 functioality - XXX change this to MHub802 mode. Let's stop calling it sealed unit."

"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Not used"

parInfo.parDescription: "_X: RTC Time Offset from 00:00 X_: RTC Periodic Offset from current time XX: RTC HH:MM Offset from 00:00"
parInfo.parNotes: "The operation of the MHub802 is such that it wakes up, send a message and switches off again. 1(01 old) = RTC Time Offset. This tells the MHub that the value stored in the Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time are minute intervals from 12:00 midnight at which to wake up. e.g. Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time = 360, unit will wake up 06:00, 12:00, 18:00 and 00:00 2(10 old) = RTC Periodic Offset. This tells the MHub that the value stored in the Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time are minutes from the current time at which to wake up again. Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time = 360, if the current time is 13:09 the next wake up time will be 19:09 3(11 old) = RTC HH:MM Offset. There are 4 parameters that are used to specify the time that the MHub802 must wake up. This parameter specifies how these 4 time parameters are interpreted by the MHub802. The 4 time parameters are RTC Wake-Up Time 0 to 3 and entered in minutes."

parInfo.parName: Sealed Unit GPS off after lock
parInfo.parDescription: "If set GPS goes to low power mode after 3D lock"
parInfo.parNotes: "The principle behind the long battery life of the MHub802 is that it perform its required functions as quickly as possible, and then turn off again. When the MHub802 turn ON, it needs to register on the GSM network, wait for a GPS position to be computed, send the SMS and then shut down again. If a GPS position is attained before the GSM network registration is achieved, it makes no real sense to keep the GPS on. However one the MHub has a valid GPS lock, remaining ON may actually improve the accuracy of that position somewhat. However in most instances the initial 3D lock is acceptable. This parameter specifies that the GPS must turn OFF immedaitely after getting a 3D lock. If set to 1, the GPS will trun OFF immediately after a 3D lock"

parInfo.parDescription: "This is the time in seconds the unit should stay ON after the wakeup event was sent"
parInfo.parNotes:
"XXX - What wakeup event.
After the MHub802 has sent the event, it is possible that there may have been a message that has been sent to the MHub802. And thus some time needs to be allowed to be able to recieve that event. This parameter specifies the time in seconds that the MHUb802 will remain ON after the event has been sent."

"The MHub detects the acceleration and deceleration of the vehcile by using the speed sensor. If the MHub decelerates faster than the value specified in this parameter, is it deemed to be in the harch braking violation state. The units of this parameter is in km/h/s."

"The MHub detects the acceleration and deceleration of the vehcile by using the speed sensor. If the MHub accelerates faster than the value specified in this parameter, is it deemed to be in the excessive acceleration violation state. The units of this parameter is in km/h/s."

parInfo.parName: Power Mode time to Deep Sleep
parInfo.parNotes: "This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait from IDLE power mode before it enters Deep Sleepmode. Deep Sleep mode must be enable in parameter "Enable Deep Sleep Mode" before this will take effect."

parInfo.parDescription: "Periodic Position while a trip is not in progress"
parInfo.parNotes: "Similar to the Periodic Position Event, the MHub also has the ability to send an event when the ignition is OFF. The value of this parameter specifies the interval in seconds that the MHub will send the Non Trip Periodic events."

parInfo.parDescription: "The number of attempts that the MHub will make to establish a session with MProfiler before the standoff period comes into effect."
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub attempts to make a GPRS connection to Mprofiler, and the attempt is not successful, it will try again. After a number of tries the MHub must assume that a login is not possible at this time, and then enters a standoff period where is will wait for a certain time before trying agan. This parameter specifies the number of login attempts before the standoff period kicks in."

parInfo.parDescription: "The amount of time that the MHub will wait in between socket attempts after the maximum number of unsuccessful session attempts."
parInfo.parNotes: "After the standoff period starts as defined in parameter xxx, this parameter specifies the time in seconds that the standoff period will last before the MHub attempts to log into Mprofiler again."

parInfo.parDescription: "Global Power Sleep Mode Enablement variable. Program with value 0xCC to enable power sleep mode and any other value to disable."
parInfo.parNotes: "Global Power Sleep Mode Enablement variable. Program with value 0xCC to enable power sleep mode and any other value to disable."

parInfo.parNotes: "J1939 FMS Vehicle Info Report Interval in seconds. This Event will only be sent during trip."

parInfo.parName: Enable GPS FixNow Mode in Sleep
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable GPS FixNow Mode in Sleep will have the GPS powered in sleep mode until Power Mode time to Deep Sleep has elapsed."

"Enable GPS AssistNow Autonomous AssistNow Autonomous can provide quicker start-up times (lower the TTFF) provided that data is available for enough visible satellites. This is particularly true under weak signal conditions where it might not be possible to download broadcast ephemerides at all, and, therefore, no fix at all would be possible without AssistNow Autonomous (or A-GPS). The AssistNow Autonomous orbit (satellite position) accuracy depends on various factors, such as the particular type of satellite vehicle, the accuracy of the underlying broadcast ephemeris, or the orbital phase of the satellite and Earth, and the age of the data (errors add up over time). The positioning accuracy depends on various factors, such as the satellite position accuracy, the number of visible satellites, and the geometry (DOP) of the visible satellites. Position fixes that include AssistNow Autonomous orbit information may be significantly worse than fixes using only broadcast ephemerides. "

"Disable GPS Speed Accuracy Filter.
GPS Speed Accuracy Filter will require the current GPS Speed to be greater than the current GPS Speed Accuracy measure to be used in calculations and events. "

"Tachograph Driver ID. The TCO driver ID consists of 16 Characters of which up to 5 will be used to convert into a MHub Driver ID. Digits 10,11,12,13,14 (index 1 based) will be used with the following limitation: 01234 will be 1234 21234 will be 21234 34567 will be 34567 45768 will be 45768 But 81234 will be 1234 (so here the duplicate will be 1234, but we would have this duplicate with 4 digits in any case)
e.g. AB0123456 78901 23 78901 is greater than 65535 so only digits 8901 will be used 78901 will be 8901"

parInfo.parDescription: "This sets the threshold for Z-Axis impacts (Impacts in the vertical axis, such as potholes and road irregularities) The lowest that this can be set to is a deltaV of 1. If it could be set to a lower value than this, it will result in excessive false accidents. n deltaV = N x 0.02 1 deltaV = 50 2 deltaV = 100"
parInfo.parNotes: "This sets the threshold for Z-Axis impacts (Impacts in the vertical axis, such as potholes and road irregularities) The lowest that this can be set to is a deltaV of 1. If it could be set to a lower value than this, it will result in excessive false accidents. n deltaV = N x 0.02 1 deltaV = 50 2 deltaV = 100"

parInfo.parDescription: "This sets the magnitude threshold for the Standard Deviation calculation. This is the minimum magnitude that vibrations need to exceed trigger the Standard Deviation flag, lockout or burst data. Standard Deviation is used to detect whether the device experiences excessive vibration due to it being mounted incorrectly. This mechanism can be used to detect excessive vibration and also lockout the accident detection mechanism if excessive vibration is present."
parInfo.parNotes: "This sets the magnitude threshold for the Standard Deviation calculation. This is the minimum magnitude that vibrations need to exceed trigger the Standard Deviation flag, lockout or burst data. Standard Deviation is used to detect whether the device experiences excessive vibration due to it being mounted incorrectly. This mechanism can be used to detect excessive vibration and also lockout the accident detection mechanism if excessive vibration is present. n StdDev = N x 0.02 0.4 StdDev = 20 1.0 StdDev = 50"

parInfo.parDescription: "This sets the minimum time threshold for the Standard Deviation calculation. This is the minimum duration that vibrations need to be present to trigger the Standard Deviation flag, lockout or burst data. Standard Deviation is used to detect whether the device experiences excessive vibration due to it being mounted incorrectly. This mechanism can be used to detect excessive vibration and also lockout the accident detection mechanism if excessive vibration is present."

parInfo.parDescription:
"Total engine displacement in ml. For example a 2 litre engine would have a value such as 1956 which would be the volumetric displacement of all pistons in all cylinders. This value is unique to each engine model.
This value is needed for the calculation of Fuel Usage where Mass Air Flow is not supplied by the vehicle and Absolute Load is supplied instead. Most diesel vehicles will require this parameter to be entered if Fuel usage is to be calculated."
parInfo.parNotes:
"Total engine displacement in ml. For example a 2 litre engine would have a value such as 1956 which would be the volumetric displacement of all pistons in all cylinders. This value is unique to each engine model.
This value is needed for the calculation of Fuel Usage where Mass Air Flow is not supplied by the vehicle and Absolute Load is supplied instead. Most diesel vehicles will require this parameter to be entered if Fuel usage is to be calculated."

"GPS Max Speed Filter for populating Trip Max Speed. 0 Disable. Always Populate 206-255 Disable. Always Populate
GPS Speed Accuracy Threshold 1-100 GPS Speed Accuracy threshold in kmph. Will only use speed when GPS Speed Accuracy is equal or less than threshold
1st Order Low Pass Filter 201 GPS Speed Low Pass Filter value to populate Max Speed, 1 over minimum speeding time coefficient 202 GPS Speed Low Pass Filter value to populate Max Speed, 0.1000 coefficient 203 GPS Speed Low Pass Filter value to populate Max Speed, 0.0166 coefficient
Reduce Speed by GPS Speed Accuracy 204 Use (Speed - Speed Accuracy) e.g. floor to populate Max Speed
GPS Position Accuracy Filter combined with minimum satellite count 205 Only populate Max Speed if Satellite count 6+ and Position Accuracy 1-5m "

parInfo.parName: Main Voltage Low Pre-Sleep Scan Report Count
parInfo.parDescription: "The number of reports that must be generated before the unit will expedite sleep scan to send the reports. 0 - Disables this feature. The event will only be sent at the next scheduled sleep scan. >0 - Enables immediate sleep scan once the number of events has been generated. This number should be less than or equal to the Mains low report count. If this parameter is set to any value and the Report Count is zero then sleep scan will be expedited after the first event."
parInfo.parNotes:
"The number of reports that must be generated before the unit will expedite sleep scan to send the reports.
0 - Disables this feature. The event will only be sent at the next scheduled sleep scan.The unit will not wake to sleep scan.
>0 - Enables immediate sleep scan once the number of events has been generated.
This number should be less than or equal to the Mains low report count.
**NB:** If this parameter is set to any value and the Report Count is set to zero then sleep scan will be expedited after the first event and not after the configured number of events."

"Total Siren Time in seconds. After Time-out Siren will go off. 0 will make siren time indefinite. "

"When the geoloc geofence is automatically created around the current location of the MHub, this parameter specifies the radius of that geofence as a difference between two latitude and longitude values. "

parInfo.parDescription: "Sealed Unit RTC wake-up time in Minutes"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the timer that is used with the mode is set to XXX. Time is in minutes - Really should write somehting better here"

parInfo.parDescription: "Maximum on time in seconds with ignition on"
parInfo.parNotes:
"XXX - Change this to tamper instead of ignition
The Mhub802 can be mounted with a tamper detection in place so that if it is removed from its mounting place, it will wake up immediately. This operation is outside of the noemal operation of the MHub802. When the tamper it triggered, this parameter specifies for how long the MHub801 will remain on before turning OFF again. Note that it the tamper detection is still triggererd by the time the MHub is supposed to turn OFF again, it will not turn OFF."

parInfo.parDescription: "This is the time in seconds before forcing the unit to send the Wakeup event even when it does not have a 3D GPS lock"
parInfo.parNotes: "When the MHub802 wakes up, one of its tasks is to get a 3D GPS lock as quickly as possible. However it may be that it is impossible for the MHub802 to get a GPS location at all. To prevent the MHub802 from staying ON for too long and thus reducing the battery life, this parameter specifies a maximum time in seconds that the MHub802 will wait for a 3D GPS lock. If a lock is not achieved after waiting this amount of time, the event will be sent in anyway, indicating that the GPS lock wan not valid."

parInfo.parDescription: "Periodic Positions for when the geoloc has been breached - in seconds"
parInfo.parNotes: "The Mhub802 has geoloc functionality, whereby a command is sent to the MHub802 that will cause it to create a geofence around its current location. Every time the MHub802 wakes up, the location is checked to see if it is still inside this geoloc geofence. If it is outside of the geofence, the MHub802 will enter an Alarm mode and will send periodic locations at the interval specified by this parameter in seconds."

parInfo.parDescription: "Periodic Position Interval when the unit is in Emergency Mode - in seconds"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is where an emergency event is sent to the MHub to place it into an Emergency mode. In this mode this parameter specifies the time interval in seconds that periodic positions will be sent."

parInfo.parDescription: "Periodic Position Interval for when the unit is in Tamper Mode - in seconds"
parInfo.parNotes:
"The tamper mode described in XXX will also result in the MHub802 sending periodic location events. This parameter specifies the interval at which the MHub802 will send periodic events while in Tamper mode.
"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable and disable default scanned event triggers"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default scanned trigger ON or OFF. If the corresponding bit is 0 then the trigger is not scanned else it is scanned. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF"

"This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default forced trigger ON or OFF. If the corresponding bit is 0 then the trigger is not scanned else it is scanned. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF"

parInfo.parDescription: "Include the Trigger ID in event reports so that the trigger responsible for the event can be identified"
parInfo.parNotes: "When an event is sent by the MHub, that event can be configured to include the Trigger ID of the trigger that caused the event. If this parameter is set to 1, then all events transmitted will include the trigger ID."

Include position accuracy and position source in each event"

"The MHub has the ability to reset itself once a day. Setting this to 1 will enable this daily reset."

parInfo.parDescription: "Hardware Reset Enable when doing daily reset"
parInfo.parNotes: "When the daily reset is executed, it is only a restart of the system program. If this bit is set, the daily reset will also perform a hardware reset of the various components of the MHub as well."
"Power Lockout at boot. This will prevent the modem from starting if Li-ion battery power is too low. Maximum Lockout time is 240s (4 minutes)"

"If the daily reset is enabled in parameter "Daily Reset Enable", this parameter will specify the time offset in minutes from midnight at which time the reste will occur. Keep in mind that the MHUhb operates only on GMT (UTC) time."

"For correct operation of the Mhub in a vehicle, the MHub needs to know the state of the ignition line of the vehicle. There is however more than one way that the MHUb can detect the state of ignition. If the IGnition wire input of the MHub is conbnected to the ignition of the vehicle, then this value must be set to 1, and the MHub will use the ignition line as the source of ignition."

"In addition to being able to use the ignition line as the source of ignition for the MHub, to make an installation easier without having to connect the ignition line, the source fro ignition can be set to main voltage. To do this, this parameter is enable. If ignition is set to main voltage, the MHub will monitor the input voltage, and if it is above the threshold specified in "Ignition Source from Main Voltage Threshold", the ignition is ON, and below the threshold, ignition is OFF."

"One more possible source of ignition is to use RPM. If RPM is greater than the value specified in parameter "Ignition Source from RPM Threshold", the engine is running and the ignition is ON. If rpm is to be used as ignition, this parameter is set to 1."
"When CAN bus is used, this can also be used for the source of ignition. "

"One more possible source of ignition is to use Speed. If Speed is greater than the value specified in parameter "Ignition Source from RPM Threshold", the vehicle is moving. If speed is to be used as ignition, this parameter is set to 1."
"Ignition Source is set to Trigger which is a software controlled ignition source."

"One more possible source of ignition is to use Accelerometer movement. If Accelerometer movement is greater than the value specified in parameter "Accelerometer Ignition On Threshold", the vehicle is moving. If Accelerometer is to be used as ignition, this parameter is set to 1."
"Ignition Source Alternate uses new method for ignition. Configure sources with Trip Source Ignition Line etc."

parInfo.parDescription: "RPM Threshold for Ignition On if Ignition Source from RPM"
parInfo.parNotes: "When the source of ignition is set to RPM, the value of this parameter contains the threshold RPM above which the vehicles ignition is deemed to be ON. "

parInfo.parName: Ignition Source from Main Voltage Threshold
parInfo.parDescription: "Main Voltage Threshold for Ignition On if Ignition Source from Main Voltage"
parInfo.parNotes:
"When main voltage is used as the source of ignition, this parameter is the voltage threshold above which ignition will be assumed ON. Typically in a 12V vehicle this should be 13V, the parameter is in 100mv steps, thus the value of the parameter will be 130.
XXX - just a comment - what about a 24V vehicle, will 255 be enough - should the parameter no be increased to 16 bits?"
"The MHub can take its source of RPM from various inputs. If RPM is determined by connecting the RPM wite to the "W" terminal, then this parameter must be set to 1."

"The MHub can take its source of RPM from various inputs. If RPM is determined by using the RPM value read from the J1939 FMS OBD2 CANBus, then this parameter must be set to 1. From J1939 FMS Enable J1939 FMS CANbus Interface = 1 From OBD2 Enable Vehicle OBD2 Interface "

"Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CANBus should be Active of Passive before setting this parameter."

The FMS Standard specifies the baudrate to be 250kbps."

parInfo.parDescription: "Geofence Entry and Exit debounce ensure that travelling on the boundary of the geofence does not cause exsessive entry and exit events"
parInfo.parNotes: "This value is used to specify the amount of time in seconds that a vehicle must be constantly in or out of a geofence before the event is generated. The reason for this is that if the vehcile is travelling directly on the border of a geofence, due to the bounce of the GPS location, the MHub may calculate the unit to be bouncing in annd out of the geofence. The entry and exit events must only be generated when the vehicle is definitely entered or exited the geofence."

"The driver and passenger key reading receptacles have LED on them. This parameter will control whether those LED's are used or not."
"Output 4 Follows Ignition. If Driver Key Immobilisation is selected control will be handed over to Driver Key functionality"
"if the Global Vehicle Disablement Allowed bit is set, a command can remotely disable the vehicle overriding the Driver Key."
"Output 3 can be configured to be controlled by the Buzzer control in addition of the Speaker beeper/ringer output."
"Input 1 to trigger Active Tracking mode"

parInfo.parDescription: "Update Odometer even when Ignition or Trip is false."
parInfo.parNotes: "Update Odometer even when Ignition or Trip is false. Odometer reading is not normally updated outside of a trip or when ignition off because of GPS drift, E.g. Gps Position changes when vehicle is stationary, because it can cause big odometer errors."

"The value of this parameter specifies the high temperature threshold of temperature sensor 1. Note that the units of this parameter are celcius+50. Thus if the value for the high threshold is to be -10 celcius then set it to 40. "

"The value of this parameter specifies the low temperature threshold of temperature sensor 1. Note that the units of this parameter are celcius+50. Thus if the value for the low threshold is to be -10 celcius then set the value to 40."
"See Temperature 1 High Threshold"
"See Temperature 1 Low Threshold"
"See Temperature 1 High Threshold"
"See Temperature 1 Low Threshold"
"See Temperature 1 High Threshold"
"See Temperature 1 Low Threshold"

parInfo.parDescription: "The amount of time that an AT command from outside the MHub will be allowed to complete execution before the MHub gathers the response."
parInfo.parNotes: "This parameter set the timeout for waiting for a response for an AT command sent from outside the MHub, i.e. via the external communications interface."

"The MHub can detect freewheeling. This is where the driver of a vehicle depresses the clutch while still travelling at a relatively high speed. This is deemed to be a bad driving practise. It is detected when the RPM is below the threshold specified in "Free Wheel RPM Threshold", and the speed is above the threshold specified in "Speed Free Wheel Threshold". It may however be permissable to freewheel for a short period of time. This parameter specifies the minimum amount of time in seconds above which the event will be generated."

parInfo.parDescription: "RPM High limit for Free Wheel condition"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the freewheeling RPM threshold on units of x100 RPM. When the vehicle RPM is below this value, and the speed is above the value specified in parameter "Speed Free Wheel Threshold", and this condition persists for more than the time specified in "OBC Free Wheeling Debounce", then the vehicle in in a state of freewheeling, and a freewheeling event can be generated."

parInfo.parDescription: "Speed minimum limit for Free Wheel condition"
parInfo.parNotes: "Freewheeling speed threshold in km/h. When the vehicle speed is above this value, and the RPM is below the value specified in parameter "Free Wheel RPM Threshold", and this condition persists for more than the time specified in "OBC Free Wheeling Debounce", then the vehicle in in a state of freewheeling, and a freewheeling event can be generated."

"When the source for speed or distance is set to the speed sensor, it is required that the sensor be calibrated first before the vehcile can be used for the readings to be accurate. This is typically done by programming the calibration factor (parameter "OBC ODO Calibration"). There is however an automated way of doing this. The Mhub is aware of its speed in anycase from the GPS sensor, so it is possible to use the GPS sensor to calibrate the speed sensor. If automatic calubration is required, this parameter is set to 1, and the MHub will then attempt to calibrate itself. Once the MHub has successfully calibrated itself, it will clear this parameter to 0."

"When the source for speed or distance is set to the speed sensor, it is required that the sensor be calibrated first before the vehcile can be used for the readings to be accurate. This is typically done by programming the calibration factor (parameter "OBC ODO Calibration"). There is however an automated way of doing this. The Mhub is aware of its speed in anycase from the GPS sensor, so it is possible to use the GPS sensor to calibrate the speed sensor. If automatic calubration is required, the parameter "Auto Calibration Activation" is set to 1, and the MHub will then attempt to calibrate itself. This parameter specifies the minimum speed that the MHub will use to calibrate itself.
In order to calibrate itself, the Vehicle must travel at a constant speed of greater than the value in this parameter for the time duration specified in "Auto Calibration Debounce"."

parInfo.parDescription: "Auto Calibration Debounce debounce time in seconds"
parInfo.parNotes: "This parameter specifies for how long the vehicle must travel in seconds at a constant speed above the value specified in parameter "Auto Calibration Speed Threshold" for Auto Calibration to occur."

parInfo.parDescription: "This allows a key to be linked to a specific customer."
parInfo.parNotes: "If this feature is enabled, only keys containing the same code as written to this parameter will allow access to the vehicle."
"Vehicle Disablement Delay from request to vehicle disabled in seconds."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable debug statements for a specific Module"
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

"The MHub has the ability to send a text message when an event occurs in addition to sending the message to Mprofiler. This parameter contains the MSISDN of the mobile phone to which the test message must be transmitted."
"This text description of the MHub in this parameter is used when sending a text SMS event."

"If the driver key is intended to control the immobiliser connection to the vehicle, then this parameter must be set to 1 alternatively if there is no Driver Key used then the Output Follows Ignition Parameter or Bit in the Output A and B can be set to still be able to control immobilisation of the vehicle via the Disablement command."
"If the driver key is used, then this parameter must be set to 1"

"The driver key is programmed with a Driver Fleet value, and the MHub is also programmed with a Driver Fleet value. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Driver Fleet on the driver key to the Driver Fleet value programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. If this parameter is set to 1, then the two driver fleet values need to match before the MHub will authenticate the driver key."

"The driver key is programmed with a class value, and the MHub is also programmed with a class value. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to use the class values in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key."

"The driver key is programmed with a Driver ID value, and the MHub is also programmed with a list of DRiver ID values. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Driver ID on the driver key to any of the Driver ID values programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. This means that for the driver key to authenticate, the specific driver ID programmed onto that driver key must have been programmed into the MHub already."

"The driver key is programmed with a Customer Code, and the MHub is also programmed with a Customer Code. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Customer Code on the driver key to the Customer Code programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. If this parameter is enabled, then the two Customer Code values need to match before the MHub will authenticate the driver key."

"In order to maintain compatibility with fleets that use existing CS905 type driver keys, the MHub has the ability to read these older type of keys. If these old keys are to be used with the MHub, this parameter must be enabled."
"None"
"If the geofence functionality of the MHub is to be used, this parameter must be set to 1 to enable the scanning of the geofences."
"The tachograph event is similar to the periodic position event. This event is defined for backward compatibity with older hardware"

"The Insurance Daily Event Time parameter is the time in minutes from 00:00 UTC that the Event will be generated and daily Insurance parameters cleared. e.g. 02:30am(UTC) value should be 150 11:00pm(UTC) value should be 1380"

parInfo.parDescription: "Periodic Temperature event will only be sent inside trip"
parInfo.parNotes: "0 - Periodic Temperature Event always sent >0 - Periodic Temperature Event sent only in Trip "

parInfo.parName: Time to wait for GPS Lock
parInfo.parDescription: "Time in seconds to wait for a good GPS Lock"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the maximum time in seconds that the MHub will wait to get a GPS position, if it does not have a valid position at the end of this time, the MHub will turn off."

parInfo.parName: Time to wait for GSM coverage
parInfo.parDescription: "Time in seconds to wait for GSM Network coverage"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the maximum time in seconds that the MHub will wait to register onto the GSM network, if it does not register onto the network by the end of this time, it will turn off."

parInfo.parDescription: "Maximum time in seconds the unit should stay ON when something causes any of the logic not to work out"
parInfo.parNotes: "This parameter specifies the maximum time that the MHub802 will remain on under normal operating instances. So if both GSM and GPS are OK, but the MHub cannot send the SMS, or has too many sms's to send, it will turn OFF after this time."

parInfo.parDescription: "Time the unit need to be outside the geoloc before a breach is triggered"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the time inseconds that the MHub needs to be outisde of the geoloc geofence before the Geoloc Breach event will be triggered."

parInfo.parDescription: "Switch the Geoloc functionality ON and OFF"
parInfo.parNotes: "Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Geoloc functionality"
"Enable the creation of a Geoloc, for current location, at Trip End. Geoloc will be disabled after ignition on"
"When Geoloc Recovery Mode is enabled and the Geoloc is Breached, Active Recovery mode is enabled. A Recovery Message is then sent every 30 seconds for 2 hours."

parInfo.parDescription: "Cancel Geoloc on trip start when driver validated"
parInfo.parNotes: "Seeting this bit to 1 means that the geoloc will only be canceled when the driver has also been validated"
"Geoloc Tow Away uses accelerometer to detect vehicle being lifted. Threshold set via Geoloc lift threshold."

parInfo.parName: Geoloc Tow Away Arming Movement Lockout
parInfo.parNotes: "Geoloc Tow Away Acc Noise Delay. The Geoloc Tow Away Arming will only occur if no movement is detected and after the Geoloc Tow Away Arming delay has expired."

parInfo.parDescription: "Maximum time that there may be no traffic on the external modem interface before the MHub takes back control of the modem."
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

"The APN (Access Point Node) is used when the Mhub will use GPRS to communicate with MProfiler. The GSM service provider will specify what APN Name should be used. A commonly used public APN is "internet" however not all networks will use this. "

parInfo.parDescription: "This is the URL of the MProfiler Server. It is used by the MHub to know where to open up a socket to."
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the URL of the MProfiler Server. It is used by the MHub to know where to open up a socket to."

"Accelerometer Recalibration Threshold is the difference between stored Calibration angles and newly calculated Calibration angle, in Degrees, that will trigger a recalibration. 0 will default to 10 degrees. 255 will disable this feature."

"Input Pulses per Unit to measure. If the input is used to measure fuel using a fuel flow meter and the meter is calibrated to say 320 pulses per liter then set this value to 320 to get the value reported as liters or set it to 32 to get the value reported in 100ml units."

"Input Pulses per Unit to measure. If the input is used to measure fuel using a fuel flow meter and the meter is calibrated to say 320 pulses per liter then set this value to 320 to get the value reported as liters or set it to 32 to get the value reported in 100ml units."

parInfo.parName: Modem Power Down Recovery Standoff Time
parInfo.parDescription: "If the modem is unable to establish an APN session within the allowed attempts then it will power itself down for the configured number of minutes. The frequency with which this can occur is governed by the Modem Power Down Recovery Interval parameter. Setting this to 0 disables this feature. "
parInfo.parNotes:

parInfo.parDescription: "0 - GSM Jamming detection disabled 1 - GSM Jamming detection enabled. Flags set on detection of Jamming signal. 2 - As in (1) but event follows debounced flag 3 - As in (1) but event follows detection flag; i.e. event sent immediately on detection of GSM jamming. NB: This is a service provided by the network and not only dependant on configuration or abilities of the MHub."
parInfo.parNotes: "0 - GSM Jamming detection disabled 1 - GSM Jamming detection enabled. parInfo.parNotes: "This parameter will Enable the Driver Fatigue Management and Reporting module which monitors the drivers time at a speed above a certain threshold and reminds him through the use of a beeper to stop for a minimum configurable time. If the driver does not stop for the minimum time a violation event will be raised and reported."

"Events can be configured to be high priority as well as what policy to use for sending it and what optional fields to include in the event report. The policy specify what mediums are allowed for communications and are configured in the "Communications" section.
This parameter is a bitfield where the bits have the following meanings:
Configuration = Bits 1,2,3 [0-7] : Policy, value between 0 and 7 Bit 4 : Not Used Bit 5 [16] : Include Location Optional Field Bit 6 [32] : Include Status Optional Field Bit 7 [64] : Event is High Priority Bit 8 [128] : Event is Enabled
How is this value calculated: As an example, configure the event to use policy 5, Include the Location Field, Include the Status Field and is enabled. Use the values in square brackets for each item and add them together, i.e. 5 + 16 + 32 + 128 = 181"

parInfo.parDescription: "Scope Debug event is intended for Unit debug purposes only. Contact Scope Support before enabling this event"
parInfo.parNotes:
"Events can be configured to be high priority as well as what policy to use for sending it and what optional fields to include in the event report. The policy specify what mediums are allowed for communications and are configured in the "Communications" section.
This parameter is a bitfield where the bits have the following meanings:
Configuration = Bits 1,2,3 [0-7] : Policy, value between 0 and 7 Bit 4 : Not Used Bit 5 [16] : Include Location Optional Field Bit 6 [32] : Include Status Optional Field Bit 7 [64] : Event is High Priority Bit 8 [128] : Event is Enabled
How is this value calculated: As an example, configure the event to use policy 5, Include the Location Field, Include the Status Field and is enabled. Use the values in square brackets for each item and add them together, i.e. 5 + 16 + 32 + 128 = 181"

Group.grpDescription: Group to configure accident detection and reporting settings

grpValue.grpValueDescription: This set of parameters disables accident detection on the MHub

This set of parameters configure the MHub for accident detection with standard values for all detection parameters. It also enables the journey log and specific accident related events. Data streaming is enabled to automatically stream any incident related data to MProfiler for offline analysis.
Set OBD2 all parameters requested including Service 3 DTC's

grpValue.grpValueName: Disable all Accident Log Event reporting
grpValue.grpValueDescription: This group disables all parameters that can result in part of the Journey Log being sent as Accident Log events. To be 100% sure it disables the Accident Log Event as well.
